He removes his socks, then DOLLY IN as he removes his pan Suddenly he hears a soft noise. He glances around then finishes removing his pants. He hears a louder noise. He pulls a towel around his waist and leaves the bathroom.
Bond comes out of the bathroom. He picks up his gun and g out onto the balcony.
We see it through curtains on a set of French doors. A na Tania runs past and climbs into the bed.
Bond enters through the French doors. He looks ahead. Tania, in bed, whips a blanket around her. PAN ON BOND as he walks toward her aiming his gun.
You look surprised. I thought you were expecting me.
Oh, so you're Tatiana Romanova.
My friends call me Tania.
Mine call me James Bond. He places the gun in his other hand and shakes her hand.  69.
Well, now that we've been properly introduced... Bond moves toward her holding the gun. She pushes it away
Careful. Guns upset me. He sits on the edge of the bed and sets the revolver on t nightstand.
I'm sorry. I'ma bit, eh... upset myself.
You like just like your... your photograph.
You look even better than yours. Much... much better.
If you are looking for concealed weapons... She touches a black band around her neck.
I take it this is your traveling outfit?
Oh, you don't think this kulturny?
Well, I'll tell you something kulturny.] You're one of the most beautiful girls I've ever seen.
Thank you, but I think my mouth is too big.  70.
No, it's the right size...
Her lips part invitingly.
for me, that is. He leans forward and they kiss.
Yes. (he kisses her again) Is it here?
What?
(brushes his lips against hers) The decoding machine —- the Lektor.
(kissing him) Must we talk about it now?
Or is it at the Russian Consulate? They kiss again, lingering.
Umm... yes.
Yes. (he leans back) I would need a plan of the place. If you could get one, we can meet at the Saint Sofia Mosque, like we were tourists.
(leaning forward) Why don't you ask me that... later?  71. She embraces him, then runs a finger down his back until touches the scar.
Now what are you looking for?
The scar. You see, I know all about you... from your file.
Mmm, do you? Well, I hope you're not, uh... disappointed. She leans back onto the pillow seductively.
I will tell you in the morning. Bond embraces her and they kiss.
revealing a mirror behind it as Bond and Tania kiss. PAN to the mirror.
We see them now through the other side of a one-way mirro PULL BACK TO REVEAL Kleb and a MAN in a storeroom; he is filming Bond and Tania in bed. He nods to Kleb.
A wide shot looking at the Aya Sofia Mosque over the Bospherous.
Tania approaches the bridge and walks up some steps. Hass enters in f.g. and watches her.
PAN ON Tania as she walks past the mosque, then HOLD. Has peers around the corner of the building at her.
A GUIDE leads a TOUR GROUP through the mosque.

We are now approaching the most interesting corner of Saint Sofia... including these two great red porphyry columns stolen and brought from Egypt. Tania enters through a side door. Bond enters behind the sightseers. He wears sunglasses and carries a bag. As the walk away he turns to one side.

In front of them, alabaster urn was brought from Bergama, a famous historical city near Smyrna. It dates back from the Alexander the Great period. Bond stops beside a towering column. Hesitantly, Tania walks closer. She stops and pulls her h back from her eyes and looks at him. Bond takes off his sunglasses and looks back. Tania looks back. Bond gestures with the sunglasses for Tania to move off.

About sixteen forty-eight, Sultan Murad the Fourth brought it from Bergama. It was used as an ablution fountain. It contains a thousand litres of water. Right after the ablution fountain we are going to a highly interesting column over there... Tania moves off and Bond does the same. We CONTINUE WITH BOND as he passes more columns then reac the base of a huge pillar-complex. Right ahead he sees Hassan, looking around the far end of the complex. Bond d forward to conceal himself against it.
known for centuries as Saint Sofia wishing column. Tens of thousands of people have wished here, putting their right hand and middle finger in the hole.  73.
approaches the pillar-complex as Hassan watches from f.g.
runs to the other side of the complex to intercept Tania doesn't see her.
stops at pillar on the side of the complex near Hassan an opens her handbag.

sets his bag down behind a pillar and runs forward pullin his revolver. He wraps a handkerchief around it. Then he returns to the base of the complex and peers around at Ha who still stands looking around the corner ahead.
Her hand sets down a compact at the base of the pillar. T UP as she walks away.

Hassan, looking around the corner, watches her go. Bond, behind the next corner, watches Hassan. Bond steps to see Tania go then steps forward again. Hassan heads for the pillar where Tania left the compact. Bond looks back, looks in Hassan's direction, looks back again.

His hand starts to pick up the compact at the base of the pillar. Suddenly ANOTHER MAN enters. His foot smashes down onto t hand holding the compact and he bashes Hassan's neck with Karate chops. Hassan drops to the floor dead, the compact his hand.
looks in Hassan's direction then steps around the corner heads for the spot where Hassan had stood.  74.
His attacker starts to walk away then turns back, pulling a pair of gloves. It's Grant. He looks ahead.
walks along the pillar-complex toward the corner.
walks quietly away.
DOLLY IN as he arrives at Hassan's body. Bond reaches down and takes the compact from his hand. He looks inside and sees a piece of paper. He removes and op the paper. It is a small, hand-drawn map.
a large blueprint of the same area. It lowers revealing
PULL BACK as Kerim sets the blueprint on his desk. Bond s on the edge of the desk holding the compact.
I promise you it wasn't one of my men who killed him.
Well, he didn't die of old age. All I know is that it saved me a job. (removes the hand- drawn map) Once he'd seen the girl, she was obviously compromised and so...
(indicating the compact) And he wasn't killed because of that!
Let's just say that Istanbul's a rough town.  75. DOLLY IN as Bond sets down the compact, approaches Kerim unfolds the hand-drawn map.
Now, let's see how Tania's map of the Russian Consulate compares with your architect's plans.
Bond's finger points between the two maps.
This is the Conference Room in the Russian Consulate. Yeah, that checks. And this is the Communication Room. That's the same. TILT UP to TWO-SHOT of Bond and Kerim.
Now, she says she works there with the Lektor every day between two and three.
How is she going to get the machine over to us?
Well, she's leaving that to me. She'll do anything I say. Kerim laughs. DOLLY BACK as he picks up the architect's drawing and sits on the edge of his desk in f.g.
Anything? My dear James, you are not using this. (taps his head) It all sounds too easy to me. (starts folding the drawing) We don't even know if she's telling the truth.
Well, I intend to find out.
Where? In the hotel?  76.
No, she won't go there again. Says it's too dangerous.
The old game! Give a wolf a taste then keep him hungry. My friend, she's got you dangling.
That doesn't matter. All I want is that Lektor.
All? (looks back at Bond) Are you sure that's all you want?
Well... They both grin, then Kerim laughs then Bond laughs.
A ferry boat passes by in the crowded harbor and toots it whistle.

Bond walks upstairs onto a deck then along the deck. He w a hat and sunglasses and carries a camera. He stops, lean back against a railing and removes his sunglasses. Tania rounds a corner of the deck ahead of him. She wears sunglasses, a scarf and long coat. Bond looks at her. She looks back. He approaches her but stops short, turning to the railing and opening his camer case. Tania walks up beside him.
Bond winds the camera.
Lovely view.
James, we must leave here now. If that agent reports my seeing you...  77.
Don't worry. He won't.
But you don't understand —- it's a danger. Bond looks at her unconcerned. He steps back and aims the camera at her.
James, look...
Smile! He presses a button, then gestures to her to move back as MAN walks past them.
Another one. Further back. DOLLY IN as they move to a corner of the deck and the man walks off.
About the machine...
That's all you're interested in. Not me.
Business first.
I know. Once you have got what you want...

I haven't got it yet. But if you tell me about the machine, well... afterwards we won't always be working on the company's time. TANIA. All right. What do you want to know? Bond glances around then lowers the front flap of the cam case, revealing a tape recorder.  78.
Talk into this. Answer my questions quietly but clearly.
How long is the machine?
Like... like a typewriter.
Weight?
About ten kilos. In a brown case. Brown like your eyes.
Keep it technical. Self- calibrating or manual?
Both. With an in-built compensator. James, couldn't we...?
Not now. Talk into the camera. How many keys?
Symbol or code keys?
Both.
The reels are spinning. PULL BACK to reveal:

The tape recorder is on 'M's' desk and he sits listening. Moneypenny sits beside him taking notes. Across the desk a NAVAL OFFICER, an ARMY OFFICER and FOUR OTHER SUPERNUMERARIES. 'M' lights and puffs his pipe. Bond and Tania's voices come through the speakers:  79.

There are twenty-four symbols, sixteen code keys. It is inserted ina slot. And the message comes out on a paper roll from another slot on the other side. And the mechanism is... oh, James... James... will you make love to me all the time in England?
Day and night. Go on about the mechanism.
Oh, yes, the mechanism. Once when it was being repaired I saw the inside. There were many perforated discs made, I think, of copper, with a small light...
Dooshka, tell me the truth. Am TI as exciting as all those Western girls? Miss Moneypenny blinks, then breaks into a cryptic grin.

Oh, once when I was with 'M' in Tokyo, we had an interesting experience. 'M' shuts off the machine. tM! Thank you, Miss Moneypenny. That's all, that's all. She gets up and exits past the men. We hear a door close, then 'M' re-starts the tape recorder.
Later, later.
Miss Moneypenny flips on her intercom and sits down at he desk. She hears the tape playing in the other room.
Those copper discs, are they light?  80.
Of course. Light, light. James, come closer. I want to whisper something.
Go on with what you were telling me... No, not that! The mechanism!
Miss Moneypenny, as you're no doubt listening, perhaps you'd take this cable. Text reads... merchandise appears genuine...
Bond sits across from Kerim's desk reading the telegram a
(overlapping 'M') ',.. merchandise appears genuine. Stop. Go ahead with deal. Signed
Kerim walks up to Bond, a cigarette in a yellow holder in mouth. Kerim takes the telegram, sits on the edge of his and reads.
(to Kerim) Now all I have to do is to tell the girl the date.
The thirteenth?
The fourteenth.
A taxi pulls up to the curb. Bond hands the driver some m and gets out. TRUCK WITH HIM as he walks to the embassy g A PORTER opens the gate for him.
Visa? The porter opens the gate and gestures to Bond to enter. passes into the compound.  81.
Bond steps up to a DOORMAN.
Visas?
(pointing; in Russian) There.
Thank you. PAN ON BOND as he walks into a large reception room. He s at a desk where a CLERK faces a MAN. There is a large clo on the wall in b.g.
(in Russian) Take and fill in this form, write your surname and bring it back to me in five minutes.
(in Russian) Yes, thank you. The man walks away.
(to clerk) Visa, please. The clerk hands him a form.
Your clock. (glances at it) Is it correct?
Always.
Of course. Bond walks to a bench at the wall. The clerk calls out "Agregarium!" A SECOND MAN rises from the bench and walks off. Bond looks at his watch.  82.
It shows 3:00.
Kerim sits on a box looking at his watch. A detonator res at his feet. In b.g., rats scurry about through a break i the cavern wall.
Bond walks back to the clerk, who is still talking to the second man.
Excuse me. You did say your cock was correct?

Russian clocks are always —- A sudden explosion smashes through the floor behind Bond. clock falls from the wall. Debris cascades down from the ceiling. Bond rises with a big grin. He says something to himself turns to an archway behind him. Embassy men run frantically around as Bond exits through archway. The clerk starts grabbing drawers from his desk. Other EMPLOYEES run behind him with drawers and files.

Smoke fills it. Bond runs down the hall carrying a gas ma TRUCK WITH HIM as he passes through a swinging door into another hall and puts on the mask. He continues into the conference room then turns to an iron gate. At the same t a LADY emerges through the gateway carrying files.
Bond lunges toward the gateway. A GUARD holding a gun tri to close the gate. Bond grabs his arm and makes the gun f wide.  83.
Tania looks up from her desk, which she had been wiping w cloth. The Lektor sits on the desk.
Bond wrestles the guard to the floor and knocks him out w judo-chop to the neck.
DOLLY IN as Bond runs in. He sees the machine.
Is this the Lektor?
(unplugs it and hands him the cord) Yes! Tania starts to cough. Bond hands her the gas mask.
Here, take this. It's only tear gas.
I thought it was for tomorrow, as today is the thirteenth, isn't it?
This is a hell of a time to be superstitious. (he shuts the case and grabs the Lektor) Come on! He runs through the gateway; Tania follows holding the ga mask.
A few flames burn. Bond and Tania run inside.
Come on, quickly! DOLLY WITH THEM as he leads her across the room to a hole the floor. He climbs into the hole, Tania following.  84.
Smoke pours out as men run from the Consulate carrying documents.
A fire truck pulls up as a crowd watches.
Firemen run toward the building with hoses.
Kerim helps Bond and Tania down some steps from a tunnel.
(to Tania) Keep your head down. DOLLY BACK as they walk under an archway into a second ca Suddenly they see a flood of rats running at them. Tania screams.
Back inside! He and Tania turn back. The rats keep coming.
Kerim watches as Bond and Tania enter under the archway.
This way! Quickly! They run off. The rate keep coming.
Kerim leads Bond and Tania through a forest of pillars. P ON THEM as they run to a stairway. They dash up two flights of steps.
A knock sounds from under a trap-door in the floor. A MAN opens it. Kerim comes up followed by Tania.  85.
Kerim, Tania and Bond run outside. They are across the st from the Consulate. The street is blocked by fire trucks spectators. They run across the street, avoiding traffic.

PAN ON Kerim, Tania and Bond as they run across a platfor a train. Bond jumps over a newsrack to keep up with them. announcement is being broadcast in Turkish. Tania suddenly stops. Bond stops and runs back to her.
What's the matter?
(looking off) Benz, the Russian security man.
sit at a table eating. Benz looks off at Tania and rises.
He takes her arm.
Come on, never mind!
Kerim stands on the steps with a PORTER on the platform b him.
(calling back to Bond) Hurry! Hurry!
Bond and Tania jump aboard and the train starts to move. and the other man look on in f.g.
He suddenly jumps up, grabbing a briefcase and hat.  86.
(to the other man; in Russian) Telephone the Consulate!
(in Russian) Yes... yes...

(in Russian) Dear Corporal Romanova has defected to the English! He runs to the passing train and jumps aboard. Grant watches him through a window of one of the compartm ZOOM IN on Grant as he closes the window.
Kerim leads Tania and Bond down the corridor.
Here's one of them... and there's the other one. Kerim steps into the first compartment as Bond and Tania to the other.
Kerim opens a connecting door to the other compartment, revealing Bond and Tania. Kerim hands Bond two passports.
Your passports. The pictures do not do you justice. I have rarely seen a handsomer couple. Bond looks at them. Tania looks over his shoulder.
(reading) Mister and Misses David Somerset. (to Tania) Your name's Caroline. He hands her a passport.
Caroline. I like that name.  87.
You're accompanying me on a business trip. On the way back to Derbyshire.
To our children?
No children. DOLLY BACK as Bond and Kerim turn to the door to the corr
Not even one little boy?
(turning back) Nyet.
I like big families myself. In fact, my whole life has been a crusade for larger families.
So I've heard. Kerim turns down the corridor. Bond stops in the doorway.
Tania?
Yes?
Keep the door locked. I'11 knock three times.
Okay. He shuts the door and she locks it.
Bond looks out the window. Kerim takes out his yellow cigarette holder and his cigarette case.
I'll go see the conductor now.
You sure he'll cooperate?  88.

Oh, we've done business before. He'll stop the train near the Bulgarian frontier where my sons will be waiting with a car. We'll be there... about six o'clock. A WOMAN IN A SCARF turns into the corridor and walks towa them.
And the airstrip?
Twenty miles. Bond and Kerim pause and back up. She walks between them down the corridor then enters a compartment.
The plane is chartered to Athens. You'll be in London tomorrow. Kerim places a cigarette in the holder and turns down the corridor.
We'll drink to that in London. He knocks three times on the compartment door.
She opens it to admit Bond. He enters closes it behind hi She wraps her arms around him.
So, we are really on our way to England!
Yes, with a lovely two-day honeymoon before us.
Honeymoon? And I have nothing to wear.
Ah! He holds up her black ribbon and puts it around her neck.
Your trousseau!  89.
(holding the ribbon) Oh, James!

(holding up a finger) Ah, one moment. He backs away raising his jacket cuffs then holds up his as if to say there's nothing there, then he disappears be the door to the other compartment. Tania looks on in puzzlement. Suddenly the door is kicked open revealing Bond holding u blue negligee.

Oh, no! James, James! (she hugs him, then glances down surprised) Oh, look! Look! She kneels in amazement to a suitcase and looks through t clothes in it. She rises holding another blue negligee. She swings aroun then holds it up against herself. Bond takes the black ri from her hand and holds it against her neck.
There. She laughs.
PAN on it as it barrels past.
Tania wears a blue negligee and dances around humming "Th Blue Danube." Bond sits on the couch reading a newspaper. She drops down and lies across him. He wraps an arm aroun her neck.
Oh, I will wear this one... in Piccadilly.  90.
You won't. They've just passed some new laws there.

Benz stands at door to Tania's compartment, listening, th moves on. Kerim rounds the corner behind him and watches. Benz pauses the next compartment door, listens and moves Kerim watches closely, then knocks on Tania's door.
Through the doorway to Bond's compartment we see her feet she lies with him in bed.
You're nearest.
Oh, all right. Tania gets up and walks into her compartment. She is weae her negligee and has her hair tied up in a bun. She opens door. Kerim enters and looks at her approvingly.
Charming! Charming! Kerim turns to the doorway to Bond's compartment. Bond emerges tying his tie.
Let's go to the restaurant car, James, for... that drink.
Surely.
(off to Tania) Charming! Kerim exits past Tania. Bond follows putting his coat on.
(to Tania) We'll continue the fashion show later. He goes out into the corridor and she shuts the door and it.  91.
Bond and Kerim look out the window.
Everything is arranged for me to stop the train. We'll get off from the restaurant car... (he nods down the hall) It's up that end.
Fine, we'll meet you there at six o'clock then.

Make it just a little later. But there are slight complications. (he turns and looks up the hall) One of the Russian security men, Benz —- he watches the airports and the stations —- he's on the train.
But he couldn't have had time to contact the Consulate before he boarded.
Well, just in case, I'll keep him company for the next two hours until it's time to get off. PAN on Kerim as he starts down the corridor.
Perhaps you'd like me to introduce you?
(approaching him) Charming! They walk together down the corridor.
Benz stands looking out the window. He hears a knock at t door and turns.

Ticket control.  92. Benz walks to the door taking some money from his pocket. opens the door then freezes. Kerim's hand aims a gun at h stomach. Benz backs away, drops onto the couch and drops as Kerim follows. Bond shuts the door. PAN OVER to Kerim. He pulls Benz' handkerchief from his pocket and stuffs it in his mouth.
Do not be alarmed, my friend. We will make you as comfortable as possible. Bond and Kerim pull Benz to his feet. Kerim takes a gun f inside his jacket then Bond pulls the jacket down over hi arms.
Now I'm sure Commissar Benz will have a much safer journey. Bond pivots Benz forward.
I'm not mad about his tailor. Are you? Bond shoves him and he drops back onto the couch.
You know, James, life in Istanbul will never be the same without you.
I'll see you in the restaurant car. Bond walks off. TILT DOWN with Kerim as he sits beside Be and starts to raise his yellow cigarette holder.
I've had a particularly fascinating life. Would you like to hear about it? Benz grunts.
You would?
Bond walks away through a doorway into the next train car Grant emerges from behind the doorway, wearing his gloves glances back at Bond then walks forward.  93.

She lies on the couch wearing a blue nightdress and looki her face in a mirror. She holds a lock of hair under her like a mustache. She hears a triple-knock at the door, jumps up and opens Bond enters looking at her and smiling.
Do you like it? She walks toward the couch. Bond follows.
Yes. It does rather suit you.
I will save everything else for England.
Uh, it is four o'clock, you know.
It is not kulturny in the afternoon? (Bond looks at her) Even on a honeymoon? (Bond keeps looking) Than I will take it off. She steps forward out of frame removing a strap as Bond watches.
I think we are talking at cross- purposes again. [A couple of hours will straighten that out. Bond pulls down the blind. ]
FOLLOW the spinning wheels.
CLOSE SHOT of the wall, then TILT DOWN to reveal Bond and Tania lying on the couch. She smokes a cigarette.
Tania...
Um-mm?
We'd better get dressed now.
Why?
It's almost six.
So?
Well, it's, uh... it's tea time.
We'll have it in here. We'll have all our meals here.
Yeah, that would be splendid. But I've arranged to meet Kerim in the restaurant car.
Mmm, you go alone. I will stay here. Bond takes her cigarette, rises and walks to is covered with the blind.

My dear Mrs. Somerset, we're supposed to be a respectable English couple. (he pulls on the blind) We would certainly have tea in the restaurant car —- 94. the window which The blind rolls up with a loud snap that startles Bond. T walks up to him.
Now, listen... (kisses her) Just do as I say, will you?  95.
Yes, James. He picks up his tie and passes her, smacking her bottom.
But there are some English customs...
(looking back) Hmm?
that are going to be changed.
(wrapping his tie around her finger) But of course, darling. She holds the tie between her teeth and starts laughing. grins.
PAN on it as it rushes forward.
Seen through the open doorway of Tania's compartment, Bon Tania are dressed. She wears her long jacket and buttons Bond wears his shoulder holster and puts on his coat.
Do I look nice, Mister Somerset?
Yes. —- Uh... He faces her and puts a ring on her finger.
Misses Somerset.
(in Russian) How pretty!  96. Bond opens the compartment door, picks up the Lektor and step into the corridor.
Tania holds up and admires the ring as Bond shuts the doo They turn down the hall.
A CONDUCTOR suddenly runs down the corridor calling urgen
Mister Somerset! Mister Somerset!
turn back. The conductor approaches.
(anxiously) You are the friend of Kerim Bey?
Yes?
There has been a terrible accident. Please come quickly. The conductor turns back down the corridor. Bond opens th door and pushes Tania back into her compartment, handing the Lektor.
No tea?
Later. Keep the door locked. He shuts the door.
Bond follows the conductor down the corridor.

head_text.subj: IN THE CORRIDOR OF THE NEXT CAR

text: The conductor leads Bond to the door to Benz' compartment MAN walks past them. The conductor looks both ways then starts to open the door.  97.
The door slides open the rest of the way revealing Bond a the conductor.

They killed each other! DOLLY BACK as Bond walks in, to reveal Kerim and Benz lyi dead. Kerim lies face-down on the floor with a knife in h back. Benz lies on the couch with a bullet-hole in his ch Near Kerim's face is his yellow cigarette holder. Bond kneels and lays his hand on Kerim's shoulder, survey the scene, then rises.
(to the conductor) This must be kept quiet until we reach Trieste.
It will be difficult.

(reaching into his jacket, with disdain) I'm sure. (Bond takes out some cash and counts it) Kerim Bey was a very influential man. He had many influential friends. I'm sure they also will reward you. He gives some money to the conductor and puts the rest aw
I'll try. Bond frowns with disdain again, then looks down at Kerim.
Bond's hand reaches down and squeezes his shoulder. Then picks up the cigarette holder.
Bond rises and, with a last look back, turns into the cor followed by the conductor, who closes the door behind the
The train races forward. Kerim's chauffeur stands in fron the station wagon on a cross-road watching. PAN on the tr as it passes him.

with his hands on his hips watches in puzzlement. From his POV, the train keeps passing by. The chauffeur keeps watching. From his POV, the train now travels into the distance. The chauffeur looks at his watch then runs back to the st wagon. ANOTHER MAN sits at the wheel. The chauffeur calls him in Turkish (we hear the word "telefona") then jumps i the passenger seat and the car drives off.
She sits on the couch folding a sweater. A triple-knock sounds at the door. She gets up and unlocks it. From outside, Bond slams the door open and glares at her.
What is it? She looks at him, not comprehending.
Kerim's dead!
Dead?
Um-umm. Tania backs up and sits on the couch, shocked. Bond approaches.
Now, I want the truth! He reaches down, grabs her wrists and yanks her to her fe DOLLY IN closer.
James, you're hurting me!  99.
I'll do worse than that if you don't tell me! You're doing this under orders, I know. What are they?
I don't know what you mean.
Liar! He slaps her face and she flies back, landing on the couc Bond goes
(holding her cheek) Even if you kill me I can say nothing. I did not know anything like Kerim's death would happen. But when we get to England, I tell you. to her.
Go on.
(falling back crying) Oh, no!
(sitting beside her) Tania, maybe they didn't let you in on all of this, but whatever you do know, tell me. He grabs her arms from behind. She responds by stroking h hand.
I know I love you, James. I love you.
Just tell me.
I love you, I love you, it's true.
Sure.  100. He rises, takes the Lektor from an overhead luggage rack, into his compartment and shuts the door. We hear Tania crying.
The train races forward. PAN on it as it goes by. FADE IN SUPERIMPOSITION of a map of Europe and PAN across it, sho the train's route, from 'Sofiya' to 'Beograd.'
The train approaches the station. The SUPERIMPOSITION FAD OUT.
(calling) Belgrade! Belgrade!
Kerim's son MAHMET, wearing a suit and tie and holding hi hat, watches.
comes to a stop at the platform. Bond immediately alights reaching inside his coat.
sees him and follows.

Bond walks past the train putting a cigarette in his mout Through the windows behind him we see Grant inside follow him. Bond stops and looks back. Grant disappears behind a partition. Bond walks forward again. Grant again follows. Nearing the end of the train, Bond stops and looks around people walking by
Mahmet, holding a cigarette, hurries to Bond.
Excuse me.  101. Bond turns to face him.
May I borrow a match?
(lighting his cigarette) I use a lighter.
Better still.
Until they go wrong. Bond gestures feebly, slips the lighter into his pocket a starts walking with Mahmet; TRUCK with them.
My brother telephoned me. Why did the train not stop?
Well, I... I have some... some bad news. Bond stops and gives Mahmet a direct look.
Your father's dead.
Who did it? Tell me.
Well, he took care of that himself. The other man died first. (all business) Now, listen. Bond tosses his cigarette aside. DOLLY IN closer.

I'll need some help to get across the frontier strip between Yugoslavia and Trieste. I want you to send a message to 'M' in London. Tell him to send someone from Station Y to meet me in Zagreb. All right?
I will.  102.
Good. Bond nods to him, then PAN on Bond as he walks away. Then stops and turns back.
Oh. DOLLY BACK as Bond returns to Mahmet taking out Kerim's w and cigarette holder.
(handing them to Mahmet ) You'll, uh —- I think you'll want these.
(calling to Bond in French) Monsieur Somerset, the train is leaving!
(to Bond) Thank you.
(backing away) Ciao.

(in English) The train is leaving! Bond turns and walks off. Mahmet turns the other way and looks at the objects in his hands. DOLLY BACK as he walks away. Then HOLD on the train.
